meanings.definition: Characterized by platitudes; dull and insipid.
meanings.sent1: The speech was so platitudinous that most of the audience fell asleep.
meanings.sent2: Her platitudinous remarks added nothing new to the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's platitudinous jokes were met with polite chuckles.
meanings.sent4: The movie's plot was predictable and platitudinous, lacking any originality.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's platitudinous lectures failed to engage the students.

meanings.sent1: He rolled his eyes at yet another platitudinous from the politician.
meanings.sent2: The book was filled with cliches and platitudinous that offered no real insight.
meanings.sent3: The meeting was full of platitudinous that made everyone groan inwardly.
meanings.sent4: Her apology sounded more like a platitudinous than a sincere expression of regret.
meanings.sent5: The coach's halftime speech was nothing but platitudinous, lacking any real motivation.
